title: Caster With Cover
provenance: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Cahn, Jr. in memory of Rosalie S. and William M. Cahn
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Cahn, Jr. in memory of Rosalie S. and William M. Cahn
description: Largest in a set of three (3) casters; octagonal baluster form with molded foot, pear-shaped body and reeded grille; covers with molded edge, eight panels tapered toward baluster finial, and pierced in panels of alternating design of floral scrolls and rosettes; the panels linked by chased strapwork bonds pierced with dots; covers with bezel closures; each castor engraved mid-body with a coat-of-arms in with a scroll and foliate cartouche, and below a crest (unidentifiable).  Artist: Charles Adam (active ca. 1703-after ca. 1711)

tombstone.epitaph: Caster With Cover. Silver. Gift of Mr. and Mrs. William M. Cahn, Jr. in memory of Rosalie S. and William M. Cahn. 1981-49-10-a,b.
